text: Habenaria thomana is a species of plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is found in Cameroon, Equatorial Guinea (on the island of Bioko), and São Tomé Island. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==Description== The orchid grows on the ground and has short stems, up to 4 cm long. It has 4-10 leaves, 11–19 cm long and 4–4.5 cm wide. Its 14-30 whitish to greenish flowers stand in terminal racemes. == References == thomana Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Flora of São Tomé Island Category:Orchids of Cameroon Category:Orchids of Equatorial Guinea Category:Endemic flora of Cameroon Category:Endemic flora of Equatorial Guinea Category:Endemic flora of São Tomé and Príncipe Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Habenaria thomana
